dataroom_source: Hyperion Ventures I LP - Portfolio Summary (10.26.25).xlsx
health_descriptor: Power Law Portfolio with Execution Risk

executive_summary.strength: Two exceptional winners (Figure AI $39.5B, Quantinuum $10.6B) with tier-1 validation. Early-stage entry (Figure Series A at $420M, Quantinuum 2020 via Firmament) demonstrates strong sourcing.
executive_summary.primary_risk: Figure AI's $39B pre-revenue valuation requires significant execution. Current: 1 robot at BMW vs. projections of 100K over 4 years. Tesla Optimus and Chinese competition add pressure.
executive_summary.thesis: Deeptech breakthrough potential with technical moat focus. Coherent thesis validated by winners.

stage_evolution.analysis: Disciplined early-stage entry (71% pre-seed/seed), with successful graduates to late-stage (Figure Series C+, Quantinuum $10.6B).

by_moat.notes: Patents, proprietary tech, but commoditization risk
Emerge: patents provide limited moat in crowded XR market

defensibility.analysis: Hyperion bets almost exclusively on technical differentiation as moat. Validated by top winners (Quantinuum technical leadership, Figure first-mover BMW deployment), but emerging portfolio shows weaker moats.

winners.name: Figure AI

research.valuation_note: current value likely significantly higher than dataroom mark

winners.portfolio_contribution: Likely drives majority of portfolio value
winners.status: Single robot pilot at BMW (commercial scale unproven)
winners.strength: Exceptional fundraising ($2B from Microsoft, NVIDIA, Bezos), first-mover BMW deployment before Tesla, founder track record (Vettery $110M exit, Archer $2.7B IPO)

risk.description: $39B valuation for pre-revenue company with 1 robot deployed requires significant execution. Gap between current state (1 robot) vs. projections (100K over 4 years) is vast. Intense competition from Tesla (AI/cost advantages) and Chinese players (pricing pressure).

winners.name: Quantinuum

research.valuation_note: current value likely higher than dataroom mark

winners.portfolio_contribution: Drives significant portion of portfolio value
winners.status: Commercial revenue, Fortune 500 customers (Amgen, BMW, JPMorgan Chase, SoftBank), Helios product launched November 2025
winners.strength: Industry-leading 99.921% two-qubit gate fidelity, 48 error-corrected logical qubits, strategic backing (Honeywell 54%, NVIDIA, Fidelity), production-scale deployments

risk.description: Quantum computing market timing uncertain (commercialization 2030+), competitive intensity increasing (IonQ M&A aggressive, Google/IBM research), valuation pace rapid ($5.3B â†’ $10.6B in 18 months = high expectations). Much lower risk than Figure due to commercial traction and technical validation.

emerging.name: Biofire Technologies
emerging.status: Product shipped August 2024 (pilot phase), thousands of preorders
emerging.opportunity: Biometric smart gun addresses safety concerns, demand validated by backlog
emerging.risk: Production capacity constraints (12-16 month backlog), gun owner skepticism of electronics, unproven long-term reliability

emerging.name: Hephaestus Technologies
emerging.status: AI simulation software for fusion (not actual fusion reactor)
emerging.opportunity: Addresses fusion infrastructure gap, LOIs with Commonwealth Fusion and Helion
emerging.risk: Expected $40M-$50M raise (Q1 '24) did not materialize. Very early stage, dependent on fusion commercialization (5-10+ years). Normal for emerging companies.

emerging.name: Innerworks
emerging.status: Commercial revenue, production customers (1inch partnership, national infrastructure pilots)
emerging.opportunity: AI fraud detection is emerging high-growth cybersecurity segment
emerging.risk: Nascent market, competition from incumbents, limited customer logos publicized. Positive signal: Seed round raised August 2025, real-world deployments.

emerging.name: Emerge
emerging.opportunity: Ultrasound haptics for XR, Disney and Sony partnerships
emerging.risk: VR/AR market headwinds (Meta losses, Apple Vision Pro slow adoption). Product still in limited beta. Normal for emerging companies.

emerging.name: Dirac
emerging.opportunity: AI for manufacturing optimization, Siemens partnership verified
emerging.risk: Customer claims (Anduril, Stellantis, Lockheed) unverified. First-time founder. Normal execution uncertainty for emerging companies.

red_flags.name: Natrion
red_flags.opportunity: Solid-state battery technology addresses EV range/safety concerns if GM partnership can be revived
red_flags.concern: Expected $60M-$100M GM deal did NOT materialize
red_flags.evidence: Only $4.4M raised in 2024 vs. $60M-$100M dataroom projection = 93% shortfall
red_flags.pattern: Material discrepancy between dataroom projections and reality

red_flags.name: Scout AI
red_flags.opportunity: AI prospecting is growing sales SaaS segment
red_flags.concern: Seed round projected Q1 '24 NOT publicly announced after 1 year
red_flags.evidence: Minimal public presence (no press, no named customers), tiny team (7 people), severe external validation gaps
red_flags.pattern: Paper valuation may not reflect reality without external validation

other.name: Marathon Fusion
other.status: Extremely early stage (founded 2023), LOIs only, dependent on fusion commercialization (5-10+ years). Long timeline normal for fusion sector.

other.name: Normal Computing
other.status: Dataroom claims $17M Series A (April 2024) not publicly verified. Thermodynamic computing is experimental. F500 pilots claimed but unverified.

other.name: Mesh Optical
other.status: Too early to assess (9 months post-incorporation, February 2025). Stealth mode, no public funding disclosed. Minimal information.

key_risk.title: Figure AI Valuation & Execution
key_risk.problem: Figure AI ($39B, pre-revenue) likely drives >50% of portfolio NAV. Current state: 1 robot deployed at BMW. Required: scale to 100K robots over 4 years at <$20K unit cost while facing Tesla Optimus and Chinese competition.
evidence: $39B for pre-revenue company = extreme execution requirements
Current unit cost likely $120K-$250K vs. <$20K target
Marks set during 2024-2025 AI hype cycle
key_risk.recommendation: Monitor Figure AI execution (BMW deployment scale, customer wins, BotQ production ramp, Series D valuation). Note: Quantinuum ($10.6B, commercial revenue, Fortune 500 customers) provides balance and validates thesis when Figure is excluded.

critical.details: Track BMW deployment scale (beyond 1 robot), additional customer announcements, BotQ production ramp, unit economics progress toward <$20K target, Tesla Optimus timeline
Independently validate Natrion (GM deal status, actual 2024 funding vs projection), Scout (seed round status, customer traction)
Understand portfolio value sensitivity to Figure AI execution (scenarios at $39B / $25B / $15B valuations)

further_investigation.why: Request actual price per share data from dataroom to calculate precise MOIC
questions: Does price per share data reveal dilution or preferential terms?

further_investigation.why: Deep dive on commercialization timeline and customer pipeline
questions: What's the path from 1 robot to production scale?

further_investigation.why: Validate customer/partnership claims for Normal Computing, Dirac, Emerge
Research remaining 21 companies if comprehensive due diligence needed (prioritize Eve Nexus $120M entry, ALL.SPACE $286M entry)
questions: Note: Unlikely to significantly impact fund returns given power law dynamics
